INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT 


DATE OF PROCEDURE: January 12, 2026


INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 23-year-old female who presents with recurrent lung nodule requiring airway inspection.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained. 


CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.


PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS 

R91.8 Other nonspecific abnormal finding of lung field 


POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS 

R91.8 Other nonspecific abnormal finding of lung field 


PROCEDURE 

Diagnostic Bronchoscopy with bronchial washing (CPT 31622)

Moderate Sedation (CPT 99152)


ANESTHESIA  Moderate sedation.
Start Time: 13:00

Stop Time: 13:10

Total Time: 10 minutes

Medications Administered: Versed 1 mg; Fentanyl 125 mcg.
MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION  Disposable Bronchoscope.


ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 


COMPLICATIONS None 


PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and laterality.
Sedation Assessment The patient was monitored continuously one-to-one throughout the entire procedure by the attending physician while anesthesia was administered.
Airway Inspection and Findings Lidocaine was applied to the vocal cords and airway for topical anesthesia.
The mouth and oropharynx were normal appearing. The bronchoscope was advanced, and the airway anatomy was showed trace erythema in the main carina.
The airway was inspected and mucus was suctioned.

Site Inspection The previous biopsy site was inspected and appeared to have healed well.
Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMENS 

None


IMPRESSION / PLAN

Airway anatomy mild erythema; previous biopsy site healed well.

Follow up as needed.

PROCEDURE 

Diagnostic Bronchoscopy with bronchial washing (CPT 31622)

Moderate Sedation (CPT 99152)


ANESTHESIA  Moderate sedation.
Start Time: 11:30

Stop Time: 11:45

Total Time: 15 minutes

Medications Administered: Versed 3 mg; Fentanyl 75 mcg.
MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION  Disposable Bronchoscope.


ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 


COMPLICATIONS None 


PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and laterality.
Sedation Assessment The patient was monitored continuously one-to-one throughout the entire procedure by the attending physician while anesthesia was administered.
Airway Inspection and Findings Lidocaine was applied to the vocal cords and airway for topical anesthesia.
The mouth and oropharynx were normal appearing. The bronchoscope was advanced, and the airway anatomy was contained thin white secretions which were suctioned.
The airway was inspected and mucus was suctioned.

Site Inspection The previous biopsy site was inspected and showed expected post-procedural changes but was healing well.
Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

DATE OF PROCEDURE: March 15, 2026


INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 29-year-old male who presents with adenocarcinoma of the lung requiring airway inspection.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained. 


CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.


PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS 

R91.8 Other nonspecific abnormal finding of lung field 


POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS 

R91.8 Other nonspecific abnormal finding of lung field 


PROCEDURE 

Diagnostic Bronchoscopy with bronchial washing (CPT 31622)

Moderate Sedation (CPT 99152)


ANESTHESIA  Moderate sedation.
Start Time: 14:20

Stop Time: 14:31

Total Time: 11 minutes

Medications Administered: Versed 3 mg; Fentanyl 100 mcg.
MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the procedure.
INSTRUMENTATION  Disposable Bronchoscope.


ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 


COMPLICATIONS None 


PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and laterality.
Sedation Assessment The patient was monitored continuously one-to-one throughout the entire procedure by the attending physician while anesthesia was administered.
Airway Inspection and Findings Lidocaine was applied to the vocal cords and airway for topical anesthesia.
The mouth and oropharynx were normal appearing. The bronchoscope was advanced, and the airway anatomy was contained thin white secretions which were suctioned.
The airway was inspected and mucus was suctioned.

Site Inspection The previous biopsy site was inspected and was identified and appeared stable.
Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.
At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was transported to the recovery room in stable condition.
SPECIMENS 

None


IMPRESSION / PLAN 

29-year-old male with adenocarcinoma of the lung presented for airway inspection.
Airway anatomy patent with secretions; previous biopsy site stable.

Follow up as needed.
